intro: Calochortus lilacinus, commonly known as the lilac morning glory, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants often referred to as mariposas or fairy lanterns. This species is characterized by its striking lilac-colored petals and a distinctive, showy flower that blooms in the spring. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. The plant is also known for its attractive, seed-like structures that resemble small lanterns, contributing to its common name.
